27  package org.apache.http.impl.client.cache;
28  
29  import java.io.InputStream;
30  import java.util.Date;
31  import java.util.Map;
32  import java.util.Random;
33  import org.apache.http.Header;
34  import org.apache.http.HeaderElement;
35  import org.apache.http.HttpEntity;
36  import org.apache.http.HttpMessage;
37  import org.apache.http.HttpRequest;
38  import org.apache.http.HttpResponse;
39  import org.apache.http.HttpStatus;
40  import org.apache.http.HttpVersion;
41  import org.apache.http.RequestLine;
42  import org.apache.http.StatusLine;
43  import org.apache.http.client.cache.HttpCacheEntry;
44  import org.apache.http.entity.ByteArrayEntity;
45  import org.apache.http.impl.cookie.DateUtils;
46  import org.apache.http.message.BasicHeader;
47  import org.apache.http.message.BasicHttpRequest;
48  import org.apache.http.message.BasicHttpResponse;
49  import org.apache.http.message.BasicStatusLine;
50  import org.junit.Assert;

52  public class HttpTestUtils {
53  
54      /*
55       * "The following HTTP/1.1 headers are hop-by-hop headers..."
56       *
57       * @see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.5.1
58       */
59      private static final String[] HOP_BY_HOP_HEADERS = { "Connection", "Keep-Alive", "Proxy-Authenticate",
60          "Proxy-Authorization", "TE", "Trailers", "Transfer-Encoding", "Upgrade" };
61  
62      /*
63       * "Multiple message-header fields with the same field-name MAY be present
64       * in a message if and only if the entire field-value for that header field
65       * is defined as a comma-separated list [i.e., #(values)]."
66       *
67       * @see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec4.html#sec4.2
68       */
69      private static final String[] MULTI_HEADERS = { "Accept", "Accept-Charset", "Accept-Encoding",
70          "Accept-Language", "Allow", "Cache-Control", "Connection", "Content-Encoding",
71          "Content-Language", "Expect", "Pragma", "Proxy-Authenticate", "TE", "Trailer",
72          "Transfer-Encoding", "Upgrade", "Via", "Warning", "WWW-Authenticate" };
73      private static final String[] SINGLE_HEADERS = { "Accept-Ranges", "Age", "Authorization",
74          "Content-Length", "Content-Location", "Content-MD5", "Content-Range", "Content-Type",
75          "Date", "ETag", "Expires", "From", "Host", "If-Match", "If-Modified-Since",
76          "If-None-Match", "If-Range", "If-Unmodified-Since", "Last-Modified", "Location",
77          "Max-Forwards", "Proxy-Authorization", "Range", "Referer", "Retry-After", "Server",
78          "User-Agent", "Vary" };
79  
80      /*
81       * "Entity-header fields define metainformation about the entity-body or,
82       * if no body is present, about the resource identified by the request."
83       *
84       * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec7.html#sec7.1
85       */
86      public static final String[] ENTITY_HEADERS = { "Allow", "Content-Encoding",
87          "Content-Language", "Content-Length", "Content-Location", "Content-MD5",
88          "Content-Range", "Content-Type", "Expires", "Last-Modified" };
89  
90      /*
91       * Determines whether the given header name is considered a hop-by-hop
92       * header.
93       *
94       * @see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.5.1
95       */
96      public static boolean isHopByHopHeader(String name) {
97          for (String s : HOP_BY_HOP_HEADERS) {
98              if (s.equalsIgnoreCase(name))
99                  return true;
100         }
101         return false;
102     }
103 
104     /*
105      * Determines whether a given header name may appear multiple times.
106      */
107     public static boolean isMultiHeader(String name) {
108         for (String s : MULTI_HEADERS) {
109             if (s.equalsIgnoreCase(name))
110                 return true;
111         }
112         return false;
113     }
114 
115     /*
116      * Determines whether a given header name may only appear once in a message.
117      */
118     public static boolean isSingleHeader(String name) {
119         for (String s : SINGLE_HEADERS) {
120             if (s.equalsIgnoreCase(name))
121                 return true;
122         }
123         return false;
124     }
125     /*
126      * Assert.asserts that two request or response bodies are byte-equivalent.
127      */
128     public static boolean equivalent(HttpEntity e1, HttpEntity e2) throws Exception {
129         InputStream i1 = e1.getContent();
130         InputStream i2 = e2.getContent();
131         if (i1 == null && i2 == null)
132             return true;
133         if (i1 == null || i2 == null)
134             return false; // avoid possible NPEs below
135         int b1 = -1;
136         while ((b1 = i1.read()) != -1) {
137             if (b1 != i2.read())
138                 return false;
139         }
140         return (-1 == i2.read());
141     }
142 
143     /*
144      * Assert.asserts that the components of two status lines match in a way
145      * that differs only by hop-by-hop information. "2.1 Proxy Behavior ...We
146      * remind the reader that HTTP version numbers are hop-by-hop components of
147      * HTTP meesages, and are not end-to-end."
148      *
149      * @see http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2145.txt
150      */
151     public static boolean semanticallyTransparent(StatusLine l1, StatusLine l2) {
152         return (l1.getReasonPhrase().equals(l2.getReasonPhrase()) && l1.getStatusCode() == l2
153                 .getStatusCode());
154     }
155 
156     /* Assert.asserts that the components of two status lines match. */
157     public static boolean equivalent(StatusLine l1, StatusLine l2) {
158         return (l1.getProtocolVersion().equals(l2.getProtocolVersion()) && semanticallyTransparent(
159                 l1, l2));
160     }
161 
162     /* Assert.asserts that the components of two request lines match. */
163     public static boolean equivalent(RequestLine l1, RequestLine l2) {
164         return (l1.getMethod().equals(l2.getMethod())
165                 && l1.getProtocolVersion().equals(l2.getProtocolVersion()) && l1.getUri().equals(
166                         l2.getUri()));
167     }
168 
169     /*
170      * Retrieves the full header value by combining multiple headers and
171      * separating with commas, canonicalizing whitespace along the way.
172      *
173      * @see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec4.html#sec4.2
174      */
175     public static String getCanonicalHeaderValue(HttpMessage r, String name) {
176         if (isSingleHeader(name)) {
177             Header h = r.getFirstHeader(name);
178             return (h != null) ? h.getValue() : null;
179         }
180         StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder();
181         boolean first = true;
182         for (Header h : r.getHeaders(name)) {
183             if (!first) {
184                 buf.append(", ");
185             }
186             buf.append(h.getValue().trim());
187             first = false;
188         }
189         return buf.toString();
190     }
191 
192     /*
193      * Assert.asserts that all the headers appearing in r1 also appear in r2
194      * with the same canonical header values.
195      */
196     public static boolean isEndToEndHeaderSubset(HttpMessage r1, HttpMessage r2) {
197         for (Header h : r1.getAllHeaders()) {
198             if (!isHopByHopHeader(h.getName())) {
199                 String r1val = getCanonicalHeaderValue(r1, h.getName());
200                 String r2val = getCanonicalHeaderValue(r2, h.getName());
201                 if (!r1val.equals(r2val))
202                     return false;
203             }
204         }
205         return true;
206     }
207 
208     /*
209      * Assert.asserts that message <code>r2</code> represents exactly the same
210      * message as <code>r1</code>, except for hop-by-hop headers. "When a cache
211      * is semantically transparent, the client receives exactly the same
212      * response (except for hop-by-hop headers) that it would have received had
213      * its request been handled directly by the origin server."
214      *
215      * @see http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec1.html#sec1.3
216      */
217     public static boolean semanticallyTransparent(HttpResponse r1, HttpResponse r2)
218     throws Exception {
219         final boolean entitiesEquivalent = equivalent(r1.getEntity(), r2.getEntity());
220         if (!entitiesEquivalent) return false;
221         final boolean statusLinesEquivalent = semanticallyTransparent(r1.getStatusLine(), r2.getStatusLine());
222         if (!statusLinesEquivalent) return false;
223         final boolean e2eHeadersEquivalentSubset = isEndToEndHeaderSubset(
224                 r1, r2);
225         return e2eHeadersEquivalentSubset;
226     }
227 
228     /* Assert.asserts that two requests are morally equivalent. */
229     public static boolean equivalent(HttpRequest r1, HttpRequest r2) {
230         return (equivalent(r1.getRequestLine(), r2.getRequestLine()) && isEndToEndHeaderSubset(r1,
231                 r2));
232     }
233 
234     public static byte[] getRandomBytes(int nbytes) {
235         byte[] bytes = new byte[nbytes];
236         (new Random()).nextBytes(bytes);
237         return bytes;
238     }
239 
240     /** Generates a response body with random content.
241      *  @param nbytes length of the desired response body
242      *  @return an {@link HttpEntity}
243      */
244     public static HttpEntity makeBody(int nbytes) {
245         return new ByteArrayEntity(getRandomBytes(nbytes));
246     }
247 
248     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Date requestDate, Date responseDate) {
249         Date when = new Date((responseDate.getTime() + requestDate.getTime()) / 2);
250         return makeCacheEntry(requestDate, responseDate, getStockHeaders(when));
251     }
252 
253     public static Header[] getStockHeaders(Date when) {
254         Header[] headers = {
255                 new BasicHeader("Date", DateUtils.formatDate(when)),
256                 new BasicHeader("Server", "MockServer/1.0")
257         };
258         return headers;
259     }
260 
261     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Date requestDate,
262             Date responseDate, Header[] headers) {
263         byte[] bytes = getRandomBytes(128);
264         return makeCacheEntry(requestDate, responseDate, headers, bytes);
265     }
266 
267     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Date requestDate,
268             Date responseDate, Header[] headers, byte[] bytes) {
269         Map<String,String> variantMap = null;
270         return makeCacheEntry(requestDate, responseDate, headers, bytes,
271                 variantMap);
272     }
273 
274     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Map<String,String> variantMap) {
275         Date now = new Date();
276         return makeCacheEntry(now, now, getStockHeaders(now),
277                 getRandomBytes(128), variantMap);
278     }
279 
280     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Date requestDate,
281             Date responseDate, Header[] headers, byte[] bytes,
282             Map<String,String> variantMap) {
283         StatusLine statusLine = new BasicStatusLine(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_OK, "OK");
284         return new HttpCacheEntry(requestDate, responseDate, statusLine, headers, new HeapResource(bytes), variantMap);
285     }
286 
287     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Header[] headers, byte[] bytes) {
288         Date now = new Date();
289         return makeCacheEntry(now, now, headers, bytes);
290     }
291 
292     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(byte[] bytes) {
293         return makeCacheEntry(getStockHeaders(new Date()), bytes);
294     }
295 
296     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry(Header[] headers) {
297         return makeCacheEntry(headers, getRandomBytes(128));
298     }
299 
300     public static HttpCacheEntry makeCacheEntry() {
301         Date now = new Date();
302         return makeCacheEntry(now, now);
303     }
304 
305     public static HttpResponse make200Response() {
306         HttpResponse out = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_OK, "OK");
307         out.setHeader("Date", DateUtils.formatDate(new Date()));
308         out.setHeader("Server", "MockOrigin/1.0");
309         out.setHeader("Content-Length", "128");
310         out.setEntity(makeBody(128));
311         return out;
312     }
313 
314     public static final HttpResponse make200Response(Date date, String cacheControl) {
315         HttpResponse response = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
316         response.setHeader("Date", DateUtils.formatDate(date));
317         response.setHeader("Cache-Control",cacheControl);
318         response.setHeader("Etag","\"etag\"");
319         return response;
320     }
321 
322     public static final void assert110WarningFound(HttpResponse response) {
323         boolean found110Warning = false;
324         for(Header h : response.getHeaders("Warning")) {
325             for(HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
326                 String[] parts = elt.getName().split("\\s");
327                 if ("110".equals(parts[0])) {
328                     found110Warning = true;
329                     break;
330                 }
331             }
332         }
333         Assert.assertTrue(found110Warning);
334     }
335 
336     public static HttpRequest makeDefaultRequest() {
337         return new BasicHttpRequest("GET","/",HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
338     }
339 
340     public static HttpResponse make500Response() {
341         return new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
342                 HttpStatus.SC_INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, "Internal Server Error");
343     }
